verses.text: 蓋印的人在上面蓋印的是：哈迦利亞的兒子省長尼希米，還有西底家；

words.note: Refers to those who affixed their seals to the document.

words.definition: who sealed, the one who sealed
words.note: The particle '的' nominalizes the verb phrase, acting as a predicate.
Common in academic or textual references.
Refers to the traditional Hebrew text of the Jewish Bible.
Used in formal contexts for 'to be' or 'to serve as'.

verses.text: 祭司有：西萊雅、亞撒利雅、耶利米、
巴施戶珥、亞瑪利雅、瑪基雅、
利未人有：亞散尼的兒子耶書亞、希拿達的子孫賓內和甲篾；
還有他們的兄弟示巴尼、荷第雅、基利他、毗萊雅、哈難、
民眾的首領有：巴錄、巴哈．摩押、以攔、薩土、巴尼、
亞多尼雅、比革瓦伊、亞丁、
約的內容：謹守摩西的律法其餘的民眾：祭司、利未人、守門的、歌唱的、作殿役的，以及一切跟各地民族分離，歸向 神律法的和他們的妻子和兒女，所有有知識能夠明白的，

words.note: Refers to Mosaic Law
The empty square indicates reverence for God in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 都堅持和他們的貴族兄弟參與發咒起誓，必遵行 神藉他僕人摩西頒布的律法，必謹守遵行耶和華我們的主的一切誡命、典章和律例；

words.note: The empty square indicates reverence for God in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 我們必不把我們的女兒嫁給這地的外族人，也不為我們的兒子娶他們的女兒。
如果這地的外族人帶來貨物或五穀，在安息日販賣，我們在安息日或聖日決不向他們買甚麼；每逢第七年，我們必不耕種田地，並且豁免一切債務。

words.note: Refers to non-Israelite people.
Literally 'five grains', a general term for cereals.
A day of rest and worship, from sunset Friday to sunset Saturday.
Refers to the sabbatical year, when land was to lie fallow.
Contextually refers to the remission of debts.

verses.text: 為聖殿而奉獻的定例我們又為自己立下法規，各人每年要繳納四克銀子作我們 神的殿的經費，

words.note: 克 (kè) here is used to translate a biblical unit of weight, like a gerah or a specific measure.
The leading space is a traditional reverent practice in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 用來做陳設餅，常獻的素祭，常獻的燔祭，安息日、初一、定時的節期所獻的祭；又為了做各樣的聖物和為以色列人贖罪的贖罪祭，以及我們神殿裡一切工作的費用。

words.note: Refers to the first day of the lunar month, a special observance.
Here, 'that which is offered'.
Transliteration of Israel + 'people'.

verses.text: 我們（包括祭司、利未人和民眾）抽籤決定按照我們的宗族，每年在指定的時間把木柴奉到我們 神的殿，好照著律法上所寫的，燒在耶和華我們 神的壇上。

words.note: Transliteration of Levi + 'people', referring to the tribe of Levi.
A traditional method for making decisions or allocating tasks in biblical times.
The leading space is a traditional reverent practice in Chinese Bibles.
Here, 'that which is written'.
The leading space is a traditional reverent practice in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 又定下每年要把我們田地初熟之物，各樣果樹上一切初熟的果子，都帶到耶和華的殿。

words.note: An archaic equivalent of '的', common in classical or biblical Chinese.

verses.text: 又要照著律法所寫的，把我們頭胎的兒子和牲畜，就是我們頭胎的牛羊，都帶到我們 神的殿，交給在我們 神的殿供職的祭司。

words.note: Refers to Mosaic Law or divine law.
Refers to the first offspring.
The elevated space is a textual convention for reverence.

words.definition: to hand over to, give to

words.note: The elevated space is a textual convention for reverence.

words.definition: to serve, to be on duty
words.note: Often used for official or religious duties.

verses.text: 並且把我們最好的麵粉和舉祭，各樣樹上的果子、新酒、新油，都帶給祭司，交到我們神殿的倉庫；又要把我們田地出產的十分之一給利未人，利未人可以在我們所有城鎮的耕地收取十分之一的出產。

words.note: An offering waved or lifted before the Lord.
Refers to the religious practice of tithing.
Descendants of Levi, serving in the temple.

verses.text: 利未人收取十分之一出產的時候，要有一個作祭司的亞倫的子孫與他們在一起；利未人要從這十分之一中，抽取十分之一奉到我們 神的殿，交到庫房的貯藏室。

words.definition: to offer to, to present to
words.note: Formal term for presenting tribute or offerings.
The elevated space is a textual convention for reverence.

verses.text: 以色列人和利未人要把五穀、新酒、新油作舉祭，帶到貯存聖所器皿的貯藏室，就是供職的祭司、守門的和歌唱的居住的地方。我們決不會疏忽供應我們 神的殿。

words.note: Refers to staple crops, e.g., wheat, barley, millet, rice, beans.

words.definition: to serve, to be on duty

words.note: Refers to those serving as gatekeepers for the temple.
Refers to those serving as musicians/singers in the temple.
The elevated space is a textual convention for reverence.
